div.div: R/SOULSEARCHING

div.a: Reddit Leaders Deflect Censorship Criticism, Defend Policies

div.div: Reddit prides itself on its decentralized meritocracy — "subreddits are a free market. Anyone can create a subreddit and decide how it's run," it says. However, recent events have led some to question whether this attitude has gone too far.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tr67GP&via=Digg&text=Reddit Leaders Deflect Censorship Criticism, Defend Policies

div.div: MIND BLOWN

div.a: You've Been Drinking Soda All Wrong

div.div: If you’ve ever used a straw to sip out of your soda can and found yourself looking like a fool in public because that suck-cylinder bobs around your tongue like you’re making out with a ghost, we’ve got you covered today.
THE ULTIMATE DROP TEST

div.a: The Tech Behind Felix Baumgartner's Stratospheric Skydive

div.div: In an almost unimaginable stunt, Baumgartner has jumped from a specially constructed balloon at over 128,000 feet above the earth, breaking the world record for high-altitude skydives and speeds in free fall. Check out the gear that kept him alive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OzKdo8&via=Digg&text=The Tech Behind Felix Baumgartner's Stratospheric Skydive

div.div: NEVER TELL US THE ODDS

div.a: Navy Building Their Version Of C-3PO

div.div: The Navy is developing a version of C-3PO, the lovable “Star Wars” robot who appeared on the big screen 35 years ago, to fight shipboard fires.
ADD TO CIRCLE 'MISSED OPPORTUNITIES'

div.a: Google Considered Sending Baumgartner To Space With Google Glass

div.div: According to a conversation on Twitter between Danny Sullivan and a member of YouTube staff, Google considered sending Felix Baumgartner to space for his jump with a pair of Google Glass. That would have been awesome.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T2EIRn&via=Digg&text=Google Considered Sending Baumgartner To Space With Google Glass

div.div: TINY LEAPS

div.a: Fearless Felix's Amazing Jump Recreated With Legos

div.div: Because everything is better with Legos.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V0E2aJ&via=Digg&text=Fearless Felix's Amazing Jump Recreated With Legos

div.div: BOXING ETHICS

div.a: The Agony Of Ending An Agonizing Boxing Match

div.div: The central sporting dilemma of our age played out again this weekend: How much brutality is too much?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TQfWDM&via=Digg&text=The Agony Of Ending An Agonizing Boxing Match

div.div: TAKE A RIDE ON A DRUG MULE

div.a: Pablo Escobar's Colombian Mansion Is Now A Theme Park

div.div: Escobar died in 1993 and, in 2007, the 7.7 square mile estate, located in Puerto Triunfo opened as a very unique tourist attraction

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QrPIm7&via=Digg&text=Pablo Escobar's Colombian Mansion Is Now A Theme Park

div.div: RISKY BUSINESS

div.a: How Blackjack Gave FedEx Its Start

div.div: Fred Smith was having a tough time financing his new overnight delivery service, so he turned to gambling to make some quick cash.
TERRORISTS PROBABLY DON'T WEAR CAMOUFLAGE

div.a: Camouflaged Dad And Son Headed To Comic Con Mistaken For Militant Terrorists

div.div: A father and son decked out in camouflage and carrying realistic-looking fake guns caused a security scare and massive delays at the Long Island Rail Road yesterday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T0dB9m&via=Digg&text=Camouflaged Dad And Son Headed To Comic Con Mistaken For Militant Terrorists

div.div: ALL HAIL GOOGLE MAPS

div.a: Get A First Look At Google's Native Maps App

div.div: A developer has posted what he claims are (very blurry) screenshots of the alpha version of the forthcoming Google‘s native Maps For iOS 6 app.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QD7xyN&via=Digg&text=Get A First Look At Google's Native Maps App

div.div: MURSES

div.a: Is The iPad Making Men Effeminate?

div.div: A report suggests that sales of manbags are soaring, because men need somewhere to put their iPads. At the same time, women's bags are getting smaller. Is this logical?
APPLE

div.a: iPad Mini Models, Pricing Reportedly Leaked

div.div: Apple’s iPad Mini isn’t yet a real product: It hasn’t been announced yet. However, that may change soon with talk of an upcoming event. And now there is a retail inventory system reportedly showing tablet pricing in 4 different storage capacities with Wi-Fi and cellular.
MEDIEVAL MEDICINE
According to reports, the spring-operated fingers enabled the one-handed knight to grip a sword or a lance, and he remained a fearsome figure on the battlefield.
R.I.P.
Arlen Specter, the irascible senator from Pennsylvania who was at the center of many of the Senate’s most divisive legal battles died Sunday morning at his home in Philadelphia.
